newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentine Bansud non-performing loans ease.
newsitem.headline: Argentine Bansud non-performing loans ease.

text.p: Argentina's Bansud said Friday its non-performing loan portfolio ratio fell to 12.2 percent in its fiscal fourth quarter ended June 30 from 14.1 percent in the third quarter.
Provisions for non-performing loans remained at about 50 percent, the bank said. Mexico's Banamex has a 57 percent controlling stake in Bansud.

The bank released unaudited results for the fourth quarter showing net income of $12 million against $11 million in the third quarter. For the year ended June 30 it posted net profits of $42.5 million, up 191.8 percent from the previous 12-month period.
Annual earnings per share reached $0.96 against $0.33 in the previous fiscal year.
